page.title: 05Religion
page.content: St Peter's church built in 1160 is in the hamlet of Dowland. An historic building with a square tower, original leaded light windows, unique wooden pillars and carved pew ends. The church has approximately only 10 members in the care of one vicar who covers the 4 parishes of Dolton, Dowland, Iddesleigh and Monkehampton. It is picturesque but with so few members it is struggling to stay open and holds very few services. It has a peel of 5 bells re-hung in 1886, costing Â£50 but unsafe to use now. Iddesleigh Methodist Chapel was built in 1890 and is situated just outside the village. It is one of 13 chapels in the Hatherleigh circuit and in the care of one Minister, his deputy and several lay preachers. It has a membership of 26.
